title: 111_s3185
content:
The "Elko Motocross and Tribal Conveyance Act" includes a short title and table of contents, defining the Secretary of the Interior and outlining the conveyance of land to the county and the expansion of the Elko Indian Colony. The Act authorizes appropriations for these purposes. TITLE I--ELKO MOTOCROSS LAND CONVEYANCE

SEC. 101. DEFINITIONS.
- City: Elko, Nevada
- County: Elko, Nevada
- Map: "Elko Motocross Park" dated January 9, 2010

SEC. 102. CONVEYANCE OF LAND TO COUNTY. The Secretary will convey approximately 300 acres of land to Elko County, Nevada, known as "Elko Motocross Park", managed by the Bureau of Land Management. The legal description of the parcel will be finalized after the enactment of this Act. The Secretary may correct minor errors in the map or legal description. The map and legal description will be available for public inspection. The conveyed land can only be used for motocross, off-highway vehicle, stock car racing, or other public purposes consistent with the Recreation and Public Purposes Act. The county must pay survey and administrative costs for the land transfer. If the land conveyed for public purposes ceases to be used as intended, it may revert to the United States at the Secretary's discretion. TITLE II--ELKO INDIAN COLONY EXPANSION

SEC. 201. DEFINITIONS.
(1) Map: Refers to the map titled "Te-moak Tribal Land Expansion" dated September 30, 2008, available for public inspection at the Bureau of Land Management offices.
(2) Tribe: Refers to the Te-moak Tribe of Western Shoshone Indians of Nevada, a federally recognized Indian tribe.

SEC. 202. LAND TO BE HELD IN TRUST FOR THE TE-MOAK TRIBE OF WESTERN SHOSHONE INDIANS OF NEVADA. The United States will hold approximately 373 acres of land in trust for the Te-moak Tribe of Western Shoshone Indians of Nevada, as part of the tribe's reservation. The Secretary will conduct a survey to establish the boundaries of the land within 180 days. Before taking the land into trust, the Secretary must address rights-of-way within 120 days. The Secretary will complete environmental reviews for the conveyance of a right-of-way for Jennings Road to the City of Elko. Land taken into trust will not be eligible for class II or class III gaming. The Te-moak Tribe must limit the use of the trust land to traditional and customary uses. The land taken into trust must be used for traditional and customary uses, stewardship conservation, residential or recreational development, or commercial use. The Secretary, in consultation with the Tribe, may conduct fuels reduction and landscape restoration activities on the land for the benefit of the Tribe and the Bureau of Land Management. SEC. 203. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS: Sums necessary for carrying out this title can be appropriated.
